intro: Linum gomezii, commonly known as Gomez's flax, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States. It belongs to the genus Linum, which includes various species of flax known for their showy blue or white flowers. The plant is characterized by its slender stems and lance-shaped leaves, typical of many members of the Fabaceae family. It produces small, delicate flowers that bloom in the spring, attracting pollinators such as bees. Linum gomezii is often found in rocky soils and is adapted to arid environments.
